text: “On behalf of his family, they would like to extend a heartfelt ‘thank you’ to the nurses at Marion General Hospital and to all the staff at Riverside Methodist Hospital for everything they did to try and save Johnny’s life from Covid-19,” the tribute on the Synder Funeral Homes website read.
title: Ohio man dies from COVID-19 after criticizing governor’s coronavirus lockdown as ‘madness’

meta_data.description: John W. McDaniel, 60, died Wednesday in Columbus, exactly one month after reportedly calling Gov. Mike DeWine’s stay-at-home order “madness.”
